title: 105_hr2532
content: The Act titled "Health Insurance Access Amendments of 1997" includes a provision for the phase-down of preexisting condition exclusions in the group market. Section 9801 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, section 701 of the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974, and section 2701 of the Public Health Service Act are each amended to shorten the time frame for enrollment in group health plans. Effective January 1, 2000, the enrollment period is reduced to 6 months, and effective January 1, 2001, it is further reduced to 3 months. Effective January 1, 2002, the enrollment period for group health plans is reduced from 3 months to one month. SEC. 3. Extending coverage in individual market without preexisting condition exclusions. Phase-Down in Eligibility Restrictions for health insurance coverage in the individual market is amended to reduce the time period from 18 months to 12 months starting January 1, 2000, then to 6 months starting January 1, 2001, and finally to 6 months starting January 1, 2002. Starting January 1, 2002, the eligibility restrictions for health insurance coverage in the individual market will be reduced from 6 months to one month. SEC. 4. EXPANSION OF GUARANTEED ISSUE PROTECTIONS TO LARGE GROUP MARKET. Section 2711 of the Public Health Service Act is amended to replace "Small Group" with "Relevant Group", redefine "relevant employer", and update terminology throughout. The term 'relevant employer' is defined as a small employer before January 1, 2000, an employer meeting specific criteria from 2000 to 2001, and any employer from 2002 onwards. The term 'relevant group market' refers to the small group market before 2000 and both the small group market and additional markets from 2000 to 2001. The text discusses amendments to the Affordable Care Act regarding the definition of "relevant employer" and the application of information disclosure to the small and large group markets. It also includes conforming changes in guaranteed renewability requirements. Section 2712 of the Affordable Care Act is amended to adjust employee size references for the period from 2000 to 2001. Further changes are made effective from 2002, including modifications to subsection (b) regarding the group market. The Affordable Care Act is amended to adjust employee size references in the group market.
